channel.title: Kubuntu help
channel.description:
Hey, I just recently installed kubuntu onto my laptop. The installation went great, but the problem is it's not recognizing any of my drivers.
The mouse isn't working properly, the screen is all messed up, and the wireless manager isn't picking my wireless connection.
Whenever I would reinstall windows, this would happen and I would have to download these:
[QUOTE]Wireless Driver: [CODE]http://support.gateway.com/support/drivers/getFile.asp?id=20905&uid=161752745[/CODE]
Sound Driver: [CODE]http://support.gateway.com/support/drivers/getFile.asp?id=20019&uid=161752781[/CODE]
Touchpad Driver: [CODE]http://support.gateway.com/support/drivers/getFile.asp?id=20525&uid=161752804[/CODE]
Screen Driver: [CODE]http://support.gateway.com/support/drivers/getFile.asp?id=19999&uid=161752832[/CODE][/QUOTE]
Any way I can get those onto Kubuntu? Or am I gonna have to fool around with some settings or something.
Thanks for any help I can get :)

item.title: Kubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @Penguins Penguins
item.description:
@Penguins wrote:

I switched back to Windows, I had a project due the other day.

I’m going to try it again later when I have the time.

This can be locked now.

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

What video card/onboard gpu do you have?

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Clicking when you tap it is a normal behavior for touch pads and that is why it is default in kubuntu, you can change it however. I know the settings will be in /etc/X11/xorg.conf (which you open with kate, your text editor) That is also what you may be able to edit to change your resolution, whatever you end up doing make a backup of that file just in case you mess something up. If you know what kind of video chipset you have that will help as well. I advise you to join irc.freenode.net #kubuntu , they are very helpful and should be able to fix you right up, they have helped me many times.

Goodluck, let us know how it works or post here with more info and we will try to help.

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Really ? Never heard of ndiswrapper. I’m a Linux Newbie.

gl Penguins, hopefully Mopar can help.

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @Penguins Penguins
item.description:
@Penguins wrote:

The mouse is a touchpad and clicks when you tap it which I’m not used to and is pretty annoying.

The screen resolution is what I’m talking about, it’s usually 1024 x 767 (I think) and it’s now like smaller than that, and it doesn’t have any other options for any other resolutions.

Thanks for the links, Ron.

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What Ron said is not entirely true, you will download and use those wireless card drivers with ndiswrapper. Your mouse should work fine, if not figure out what kind it is and google for the right drivers. What do you mean when you say your screen is ‘all messed up’?

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Those drivers will never ever work on *buntu because it’s Linux and those drivers are EXE files that are supposed to be used on a Microsoft OS computer.

To get the drivers you need try to look on www.ubuntuguide.org or ask for help on www.ubuntuforums.org

Read full topic

item.title: Kubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @Penguins Penguins
item.description:
@Penguins wrote:

Hey, I just recently installed kubuntu onto my laptop. The installation went great, but the problem is it’s not recognizing any of my drivers.

The mouse isn’t working properly, the screen is all messed up, and the wireless manager isn’t picking my wireless connection.

Whenever I would reinstall windows, this would happen and I would have to download these:

[QUOTE]Wireless Driver:

http://support.gateway.com/support/drivers/getFile.asp?id=20905&uid=161752745

Any way I can get those onto Kubuntu? Or am I gonna have to fool around with some settings or something.
